content:
I created a new value set, http://build.fhir.org/valueset-adverse-event-outcome.html, but the displays aren't populated.

I used the code system URI (http://ncimeta.nci.nih.gov) defined in http://build.fhir.org/terminologies-systems.html and am using the CUIs as the code value per http://build.fhir.org/ncimeta.html.

Interestingly enough, I see another NCI value set, http://build.fhir.org/valueset-device-safety.html, that uses a code system of urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.26.1.1, which has displays populated.

Any idea if this is an issue with the terminology server or did I use the wrong NCI code system or code valuue (CUI vs NCI Thesaurus Code)?
The terminology server does not support that code system. So the build tool can't populate the displays. the device safety one has the displays populated manually in the value set
Sounds like we should be supporting it?
probably we should... I've done the work to do so, but I hadn't had the time to keep it current. It's distributed the same way as RxNorm, it's just way bigger
Is the infrastructure already there in the server to support it?
yes. it's pretty much the as rxnorm except...
